  • Method Details

    • builder

      public static Limit.Builder builder()
      Adds a limit that the bucket must respect.

      By default,

      • tokensPerPeriod is 1.
      • period is 1 second.
      • initialTokens is 0.
      • maxTokens is Long.MAX_VALUE.
      • minimumToRefill is 1.
      • userData is null.
      Returns:
      a Limit builder

    • getTokensPerPeriod

      public long getTokensPerPeriod()
      Returns the number of tokens to add every period.
      Returns:
      the number of tokens to add every period

    • getPeriod

      public Duration getPeriod()
      indicates how often tokensPerPeriod should be added to the bucket.
      Returns:
      indicates how often tokensPerPeriod should be added to the bucket

    • getInitialTokens

      public long getInitialTokens()
      Returns the initial amount of tokens that the bucket starts with.
      Returns:
      the initial amount of tokens that the bucket starts with

    • getMaxTokens

      public long getMaxTokens()
      Returns the maximum amount of tokens that the bucket may hold before overflowing (subsequent tokens are discarded).
      Returns:
      the maximum amount of tokens that the bucket may hold before overflowing (subsequent tokens are discarded)

    • getMinimumToRefill

      public long getMinimumToRefill()
      Returns the minimum number of tokens that may be refilled at a time. When completing a period a smaller number of tokens may be refilled in order to avoid surpassing tokensPerPeriod.
      Returns:
      the minimum number of tokens by which the limit may be refilled

    • getUserData

      public Object getUserData()
      Returns the data associated with this limit.
      Returns:
      the data associated with this limit

    • getLastRefilledAt

      public Instant getLastRefilledAt()
      Returns the last time that tokens were refilled.
      Returns:
      the last time that tokens were refilled

    • updateConfiguration

      public Limit.ConfigurationUpdater updateConfiguration()
      Updates this Limit's configuration.

      Please note that users are allowed to consume tokens between the time this method is invoked and Limit.ConfigurationUpdater.apply() completes. Users who wish to add/remove a relative amount of tokens should avoid accessing the enclosing bucket until the configuration update is complete.

      Returns:
      the configuration updater
